title: [Large-Scale] Gamification-Based Mathematics Problem-Solving Competency Development Program

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Mathematical Concepts (Integers, Fractions, Geometry, etc.)
context.additional_context: Gamification strategy design competency development for graduate students, applicable to elementary mathematics education settings.

learning_goals: Development of the ability to design math activities using the five core elements of gamification (points, levels, badges, leaderboards, storytelling).
Development of at least two game mechanisms (competitive and collaborative) to motivate learners.

Learners design an immediate feedback system for math problem-solving processes using smartphone-based tools (Kahoot! or Mentimeter) within one week and implement a prototype rated 4.0+ on a 5-point scale rubric by three or more peer evaluators.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
